qas.question: At which tip of Southampton Water is Southampton located?
What river converges with the Test?
Which river is excellent for salmon fishing?
Which river splits the city of Southampton into an east section and a west section?
What Southampton area is located between the Itchen and Test rivers?

context: The geography of Southampton is influenced by the sea and rivers. The city lies at the <a0_0>northern<a0_0/> tip of the Southampton Water, a deep water estuary, which is a ria formed at the end of the last Ice Age. Here, the rivers Test and <a1_0>Itchen<a1_0/> converge. The <a2_0>Test<a2_0/>—which has salt marsh that makes it ideal for salmon fishing—runs along the western edge of the city, while the <a3_0>Itchen<a3_0/> splits Southampton in two—east and west. <a4_0>The city centre<a4_0/> is located between the two rivers.
